title: What would happen if every non-Muslim read the Quran? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q: What would happen if every non-Muslim read the Quran? A: Personally, I tried reading the Quran, I really did, but it’s sooooo boring, I’ve already waded through the prequel, the Bible, twice. And that was boring as hell, not to mention ludicrously unrealistic. I’m going to wait until a religion produces evidence of its gods before I waste my precious time reading its myths. Pointing at an book that kinda, sorta resembles real life isn’t evidence, it’s special pleading at best. Apologetics isn’t evidence, it’s lame excuses for the lack of evidence. Your personal beliefs or experiences aren’t evidence, unless you can reproduce them, and they aren’t explicable by other means. Learn what evidence is, find some, present it. I’m not going to be intimidated into accepting religions with threats and violence, or promises of a great sex life after I die, in a place I can’t show even exists, because, you know, evidence. You need evidence and reason, the one thing religions are set up to avoid at all costs, that’s why they have to behead teachers and drive trucks through crowds, they can’t scare illiterates with tall tales any more, so they fly planes into buildings and elect orange dictator idiots to high office instead. It’s extremely unlikely that any rational person would be persuaded by reading the Quran, you might convince a few religious types to switch religions, but unbelievers won’t be fooled, very little would change.

Here’are some random passages from the Quran: Quran (2:191-193) “And kill them wherever you find them, and turn them out from where they have turned you out. And Al-Fitnah [disbelief or unrest] is worse than killing… but if they desist, then lo! Allah is forgiving and merciful. And fight them until there is no more Fitnah [disbelief and worshipping of others along with Allah] and worship is for Allah alone. But if they cease, let there be no transgression except against Az-Zalimun(the polytheists, and wrong-doers, etc.)” Quran (4:89) “They wish you would disbelieve as they disbelieved so you would be alike. So do not take from among them allies until they emigrate for the cause of Allah . But if they turn away, then seize them and kill them wherever you find them and take not from among them any ally or helper.” Quran (4:95) “Not equal are those believers remaining [at home] – other than the disabled – and the mujahideen, [who strive and fight] in the cause of Allah with their wealth and their lives. Allah has preferred the mujahideen through their wealth and their lives over those who remain [behind], by degrees. And to both Allah has promised the best [reward]. But Allah has preferred the mujahideen over those who remain [behind] with a great reward -“ Quran (5:33) “Indeed, the penalty for those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger and strive upon earth [to cause] corruption is none but that they be killed or crucified or that their hands and feet be cut off from opposite sides or that they be exiled from the land. That is for them a disgrace in this world; and for them in the Hereafter is a great punishment,” Quran (8:59-60) “And let not those who disbelieve think they will escape. Indeed, they will not cause failure [to Allah ]. And prepare against them whatever you are able of power and of steeds of war by which you may terrify the enemy of Allah and your enemy and others besides them whom you do not know [but] whom Allah knows. And whatever you spend in the cause of Allah will be fully repaid to you, and you will not be wronged.” I don’t know about you but I’m beginning to get some bad vibes here. I’m not sure having more people reading it would be such a good thing.
